text.div:
BC ObservationContext Logical Model

Context for recording an evaluation result, used to indicate an evaluation has been made.

name: ObservationContextModel
title: BC ObservationContext Logical Model
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC)
description: Context for recording an evaluation result, used to indicate an evaluation has been made.

element.definition: Context for recording an evaluation result, used to indicate an evaluation has been made.

element.short: A code representing the ontological status of the statement, e.g., whether it exists, does not exist, is planned, etc.
element.definition:
A code representing the ontological status of the statement, e.g., whether it exists, does not exist, is planned, etc.
Attribute aligns with the SNOMED CT Situation with Explicit Context (SWEC) Concept Model context attributes: 'Finding context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408729009) and 'Procedure context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408730004). The range allowed for this attribute shall be consistent with the SNOMED CT concept model specification for SWEC.

element.short: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Identity of the terminology system
element.definition: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.
element.comment: The URI may be an OID (urn:oid:...) or a UUID (urn:uuid:...).  OIDs and UUIDs SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry. Otherwise, the URI should come from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or it should de-reference to some definition that establish the system clearly and unambiguously.
element.requirements: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

element.short: Version of the system - if relevant
element.definition: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.
element.comment: Where the terminology does not clearly define what string should be used to identify code system versions, the recommendation is to use the date (expressed in FHIR date format) on which that version was officially published as the version date.

element.short: Symbol in syntax defined by the system
element.definition: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
element.requirements: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

element.short: Representation defined by the system
element.definition: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.
element.requirements: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know  the system.

mapping.map: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

element.short: If this coding was chosen directly by the user
element.definition: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).
element.comment: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen code is the most appropriate starting point for new translations. There is some ambiguity about what exactly 'directly chosen' implies, and trading partner agreement may be needed to clarify the use of this element and its consequences more completely.
element.requirements: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

mapping.map: fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:mapsTo dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:hasMap fhir:Coding.userSelected.map. fhir:Coding.userSelected.map a fhir:Map;   fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected\#true a [     fhir:source "true";     fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale\#O   ]

element.short: A description of an interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.
element.definition: A description of an interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

element.short: A clinical interpretation of a finding (applies to both assertions and observation).
element.definition: A clinical interpretation of a finding (applies to both assertions and observation).

element.short: Indicates whether the finding is preliminary, amended, final, etc.
element.definition: Indicates whether the finding is preliminary, amended, final, etc.

element.short: The time or time period that the finding addresses.
element.definition:
The time or time period that the finding addresses.
The clinically relevant time is not necessarily when the information is gathered or when a test is carried out, but for example, when a specimen was collected, or the time period referred to by the question. Use a TimePeriod for a measurement or specimen collection continued over a significant period of time (e.g. 24 hour Urine Sodium).

element.short: The finding itself, such as the blood pressure value recorded.
element.definition: The finding itself, such as the blood pressure value recorded.

element.short: Reason that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing.
element.definition: Reason that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing.

element.short: Indicator of significant change (delta) from the last or previous measurement.
element.definition: Indicator of significant change (delta) from the last or previous measurement.

element.short: The date and time this observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.
element.definition: The date and time this observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

element.short: The person or organization who observed or informed the reporter about the characteristic, potentially the clinician, the patient, or a related person.
element.definition: The person or organization who observed or informed the reporter about the characteristic, potentially the clinician, the patient, or a related person.
Context for recording an evaluation result, used to indicate an evaluation has been made.

element.short: A code representing the ontological status of the statement, e.g., whether it exists, does not exist, is planned, etc.

The range allowed for this attribute shall be consistent with the SNOMED CT concept model specification for SWEC.
